alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM EDT, The public reported heavy rain in Plantation, near University Dr and I-595 due heavy rainfall associated with thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Plantation, near University Dr and I-595 has already received reports of street flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, Lauderdale Lakes, Cooper City, West Park, Nova Southeastern University, Chambers Estates, Royal Palm Ranches, Broadview Park, Sunshine Acres, Miramar Parkway And University Drive and Melrose Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
